intro: Clidemia alpestris, commonly known as alpine clidemia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and high-altitude grasslands. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often hairy. Clidemia alpestris plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
